summary: IN SEPTEMBER 2000 THE RIGHT FRONT WHEEL OF OUR 1994 PLYMOUTH VOYAGER LX SEPERATED FROM THE VEHICLE WITHOUT WARNING.  NEITHER THE REPAIR FACILITY NOR THE INSURANCE ADJUSTER COULD EXPLAIN WHAT CAUSED THE WHEEL TO SEPERATE.  I RECENTLY FOUND SOME RECALL INFORMATION ON THE PLYMOUTH VOYAGER THAT MATCHES THE ABOVE INCIDENT (NHTSA CAMPAIGN ID #93V098000).  COULD THIS DEFECT UNDER THE RECALL BE APPLIED TO OTHER PLYMOUTH VOYAGERS?
